intro: Jacea pannonica, commonly known as the Pannonian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its roots are fibrous and fibrous. Jacea pannonica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
